Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2008 05:02PM - edited Oct 27, 2008 05:17PM by JenP2008 Thanks everyone for your kind words and encouragement.  I am crying as I type this though. I thought I was a stronger person but this caught me by a surprise. I think I will be stronger once I know the outcome so that I can focus and deal with it.  I will post again after my biopsy results come out, hopefully by Friday.  Wish me luck.
Posts.Title: Scared to death JenP2008 BessB

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2008 12:27PM JenP2008 wrote: Just got the biopsy result back.  The pathologist thinks it's Adenofibroma but recommends to take it out to examine it further, because the lump had calcification in the middle.  So now I am scheduled for surgery next Friday.  Does anyone know what Adenofirbroma is?  Is this same as Fibroadenoma?  I thought the wait will be over by today but now I face more surgery and waiting.  Too stressful...
Posts.Title: Scared to death JenP2008 BessB

Posts.Content: JenP2008 wrote: My Gyn found a 1 cm lump on my upper right breast last tuesday.  Had a mammo amd ultrasound on Friday and the Radiologist wanted me to do a biopsy.He said 1/3 chance it'll be cancer.  I am so scared.  I have been crying everday since and husband is also.  I have a biopsy schedules for this Wed.  At my age 44 I don't think it'll be a Fibroadenoma (which is more common in younger women).  The mass is not a cyst (ruled out by ultra sound.  I am soooo scared that it's malignant.  Help... Posts.Title: Scared to death JenP2008 BessB

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2008 02:58PM - edited Oct 27, 2008 05:14PM by JenP2008 Thanks Karen.  I had a mammo exactly a year ago and no finding at the time.  I am told I have very dense breasts though.  I am trying to be possitive but it's very, very hard...
Posts.Title: Scared to death JenP2008 BessB

Posts.Content: JenP2008 wrote: My Breast surgeon just called.  She said the pathologist thinks it's AdenoFibroma but not 100% sure and recommends to take it out.  Now I have to schedule for a surgery next week.  They noted calcification in the middle of the lump.  The surgeon thinks there is a good chance that it will not be cancerous but there still is that chance it could be.  After nearly two weeks of extreme stress, I still do not have a definitive answer and face more surgery and waiting.  I am thankful though that the biopsy result did not come back with a definite malignancy, but this waiting and stres is too unbearable.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Biopsy result in, confused JenP2008 easyquilts

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2008 11:39AM - edited Oct 31, 2008 01:25PM by JenP2008 Dear Emmabell, I completely understand what you are going thru.  Since a lump was found last week, I (and my husband) have been a complete wreck.  I went thru all the worst-case scenarios and tried to develop a plan to address each concern.  That helped a little.  Finding best doctors/breast surgeon also helps.  And then pray that everything will turn out OK. I will pray for you.
